author: sky.cactus
content: It sounded the other day like people prefer LEB128 over VLQ.  Is there a reason for that?

author: pauld.9606
content: VLQ starts decoding at the most-significant bit, so there is an extra final alignment shift. On the other hand, LEB128 starts decoding at the least-significant bit, so no final shift is needed because it is already aligned.

author: pauld.9606
content: Summary of reasons for LEB128 over VLQ: (i) it is easier to implement, (ii) it easier to specify in a way that gives unique readability and 1-1 correspondence with non-negative integers, (iii) it is easy to cap the length syntactically, and (iv) many major projects us it.

author: sky.cactus
content:
In 2718 we will need to touch how transactions and receipts are hashed and inserted into their respective merkle tries so the storage root can be included in a block.  At the moment these are:
```
TransactionRoot = patriciaTrie(rlp(TransactionIndex) => rlp(Transaction)).rootHash
ReceiptRoot = patriciaTrie(rlp(TransactionIndex) => rlp(Receipt)).rootHash
```
After 2718 the smallest change would be to:
```
TransactionRoot = patriciaTrie(rlp(TransactionIndex) => TransactionType || Transaction).rootHash
ReceiptRoot = patriciaTrie(rlp(TransactionIndex) => TransactionType || Receipt).rootHash
```
How do people feel about this instead (larger change, removes more of RLP):
```
TransactionRoot = patriciaTrie(leb128(TransactionIndex) => TransactionType || Transaction).rootHash
ReceiptRoot = patriciaTrie(leb128(TransactionIndex) => TransactionType || Receipt).rootHash
```
